html: The virtual repetition in these verses of verse 10, and the addition of Jehovah’s “arising and striking terror on earth,” drives home the dreadful consequences of idol worship as Jehovah’s coming in glory draws near. While his “arising” (qumo ) spells doom for the wicked, Jehovah makes provision for the righteous (Isaiah 33:10-17; cf. 31:2-5). To those who trust in him, Jehovah’s “awesome presence” and the “brightness of his glory” signify imminent deliverance (Isaiah 4:5-6; 60:1-2, 19-20). But to those who fear, who lack trust in him, hiding in the earth appears their only recourse.
